main event: Two light lights were seen crossing in front of the observer's car at a low altitude of about 500-1000 ft in Hortense, Georgia on February 3, 1958.
interesting points: The lights were described as guided, crossing in front of the observer's car, and disappearing to the southeast.
The lights were either yellow or white in color, and circular or slightly oval in shape.
The sighting lasted for about 6 minutes.
Radar at Savannah had detected an unknown target in the area at the same time.
The Commanding Officer of the Glynco Naval Base forwarded the report to the Director of Intelligence at the Headquarters of the U.S. Air Force for information and evaluation.
